text: Blessings of Moses on Israel

Now\f + \fr 33:1 \ft Or “And” \f* this \add is\add* the blessing \add with\add* which Moses, the man of God, blessed the ⸤Israelites⸥\f + \fr 33:1 \ft Literally “sons/children of Israel” \f* ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 33:1 \ft Literally “to the face of” \f* his death.
Then\f + \fr 33:2 \ft Or “And” \f* he said,
“Yahweh came from Sinai,
and he dawned upon them from Seir;
he shone forth from Mount Paran,
and he came with myriads of holy ones,

at his right hand a fiery law for them.\f + \fr 33:2 \ft This pointing of the MT is very difficult; here HALOT 93 suggests “fire a law for them” as a translation of the compound Hebrew word made up of “fire” + “law,” which I render as “\fq a \ft fiery law” \f*
Moreover,\f + \fr 33:3 \ft Or “Indeed” \f* ⸤he loves his people⸥,\f + \fr 33:3 \ft Literally “a lover of peoples” \f*
all the holy ones \add were\add* in your hand,
and they bowed down to\f + \fr 33:3 \ft Or “at” \f* your feet,
⸤each one accepted directions from you⸥.\f + \fr 33:3 \ft Literally “he takes up from your words” \f*
A law Moses instructed for us,
\add as a\add* possession \add for\add* the assembly of Jacob.
And \add then\add* a king arose in Jeshurun,
at the gathering of the leaders of \add the\add* people,
⸤united were the tribes of Israel⸥.\f + \fr 33:5 \ft Literally “together the tribes of Israel” \f*
“May Reuben live, and may he not die,
⸤and let his number not be few⸥.”\f + \fr 33:6 \ft Literally “let he be his people \fq of \ft number” \f*
⸤And he said this of Judah⸥,\f + \fr 33:7 \ft Literally “and this concerning/to Judah, and he said” \f*
“Hear, O Yahweh, the voice of Judah,
and bring him to his people;
his own hands strive\f + \fr 33:7 \ft Or “is/are great” on his behalf \f* for him,
and may you be a help ⸤against⸥\f + \fr 33:7 \ft Literally “from” \f* his foes.”
And of Levi he said,
“Your Thummim and your Urim
\add are\add* for ⸤your faithful one⸥,\f + \fr 33:8 \ft Literally “man, your faithful one” \f*
⸤whom you tested at Massah⸥;\f + \fr 33:8 \ft Literally “whom you tested him at Massah” \f*
you contended \add with\add* him
at the waters of Meribah.
The \add one\add* saying of his father and of his mother,
‘I have not regarded them,’
and his brothers he \add did\add* not acknowledge,
and his children\f + \fr 33:9 \ft Or “sons” \f* \add he did\add* not know,
but \add rather\add* they observed your word,
and your covenant they kept.
They taught\f + \fr 33:10 \ft Or “teach/will teach” \f* your regulations to Jacob,
and your law to Israel;
they placed incense smoke ⸤before you⸥,\f + \fr 33:10 \ft Literally “in your nose” \f*
and whole burnt offerings on your altar.
Bless, O Yahweh, his substance,
and with the work of his hands you must be pleased;
smite the loins of those who attack him,
and those hating him, ⸤so that they cannot arise⸥.”\f + \fr 33:11 \ft Literally “so that not they stand up” \f*
Of Benjamin he said,
“The beloved of Yahweh dwells ⸤securely⸥,\f + \fr 33:12 \ft Literally “in confidence” \f*

the Most High\f + \fr 33:12 \ft This is the most likely reading in context (Most High God). Literally the Hebrew text reads “upon him,” so the NASV translates the first line as: dwell in security “by him” \f* shields \add all\add* around him,
all the day,
and between his shoulders he dwells.”
And of Joseph he said,
“Blessed by Yahweh \add is\add* his land,
with\f + \fr 33:13 \ft Hebrew “from” \f* the choice things of heaven,
with\f + \fr 33:13 \ft Hebrew “from” \f* dew, and with\f + \fr 33:13 \ft Hebrew “from” \f* the deep lying down beneath,
and with\f + \fr 33:14 \ft Hebrew “from” \f* \add the\add* choice things of \add the\add* fruits\f + \fr 33:14 \ft Or “produce of” \f* of the \add the\add* sun,
and with the choice things of \add the\add* yield of \add the\add* ⸤seasons⸥,\f + \fr 33:14 \ft Literally “months” \f*
and with\f + \fr 33:15 \ft Hebrew “from” \f* the finest things of \add the\add* ancient mountains,
and with\f + \fr 33:15 \ft Hebrew “from” \f* \add the\add* choice things of \add the\add* ⸤eternal hills⸥,\f + \fr 33:15 \ft Literally “\fq the \ft hills of eternity \fq never ending ages \ft ” \f*
and with\f + \fr 33:16 \ft Hebrew “from” \f* the choice things of \add the\add* earth and its fullness,

and the favor of \add the one\add* ⸤who dwelt⸥\f + \fr 33:16 \ft Literally “dwells” but context puts the event into the past; literally “dweller of the bush” \f* in \add the\add* bush.\f + \fr 33:16 \ft Some scholars suggest that this expression must be read as: on Sinai \f*
Let them come to the head of Joseph,
and to the crown of the prince among his brothers.
\add As\add* the firstborn of his ox, majesty ⸤belongs to him⸥,\f + \fr 33:17 \ft Literally “is for him” \f*
and his horns \add are\add* \add the\add* horns of a wild ox;
with them he drives people together,\f + \fr 33:17 \ft Or “all at once” (NASB) \f*
and they \add are\add* the myriads of Ephraim,
and they \add are\add* the thousands of Manasseh.”
And of Zebulun he said,
“Rejoice, Zebulun, in your going out,
and \add rejoice\add*, Issachar, in your tents;
They summon people \add to the\add* mountains;\f + \fr 33:19 \ft Hebrew “mountain” \f*
there they sacrifice the sacrifices of righteousness,
because the affluence of \add the\add* seas they suck \add out\add*,
and ⸤the most hidden treasures of the sand⸥.”\f + \fr 33:19 \ft Literally “\fq the \ft covered of \fq the \ft hidden of \fq the \ft sand” \f*
And of Gad he said,
“Blessed \add be\add* ⸤the one who enlarges Gad⸥;\f + \fr 33:20 \ft Literally “the enlarger of Gad” \f*
like a lion he dwells,
and he tears an arm as well as a scalp.
And he selected\f + \fr 33:21 \ft Or “provided” \f* \add the\add* best \add part\add* for himself, \f + \fr 33:21 \ft Hebrew “for him” \f*
for there \add the\add* portion of a ruler \add is\add* included,
and he came \add with the\add* heads of \add the\add* people;\f + \fr 33:21 \ft Or possibly, “the heads of the people came/assembled” (compare NEB) \f*
he did\f + \fr 33:21 \ft Or “worked” \f* the righteousness of Yahweh,
and his regulations for Israel.”
And of Dan he said,
“Dan \add is\add* a cub of \add a\add* lion;
he leaps from Bashan.”\f + \fr 33:22 \ft Hebrew “the Bashan,” referring to a well-known geographical and agricultural area \f*
And of Naphtali, he said,
“Oh, Naphtali, sated of favor,
and full of the blessing of Yahweh;
take possession of \add the\add* lake,
and \add the land to the\add* south.”
And of Asher he said,
“Blessed ⸤more than sons⸥\f + \fr 33:24 \ft Literally “blessed from/of sons \fq is \ft ” features the comparative use the Hebrew preposition \fqa min \ft , “than” \f* \add is\add* Asher;
⸤may he be the favorite⸥\f + \fr 33:24 \ft Literally “may he be favored” \f* of his brothers,
⸤dipping his feet in the oil⸥.\f + \fr 33:24 \ft Literally “and dipping in \fq the \ft oil his feet” \f*
Your bars \add are\add*\f + \fr 33:25 \ft Or “will be” \f* iron and bronze,
and as your days, \add so is\add*\f + \fr 33:25 \ft Or “so will be/may be” \f* your strength.”
“There is no \add one\add* like God, O, Jeshurun,
who rides \add through\add* the heavens to your help,
and with his majesty \add through the\add* skies.
The God of ⸤ancient time⸥\f + \fr 33:27 \ft Literally “before/earlier time\fq s \ft ” \f* \add is\add* a hiding place,
and underneath \add are\add* \add the\add* arms of eternity,\f + \fr 33:27 \ft Or “everlasting ages” or “everlasting arms” \f*
and he drove out ⸤from before⸥\f + \fr 33:27 \ft Literally “from your face” \f* you your enemy,
and he said, ‘Destroy \add them\add*!’
So Israel dwells alone \add and\add* carefree,
the spring of Jacob in a land of grain and wine;
his heavens even drip dew.
Blessed \add are\add* you, O Israel.
Who is like you, a people who \add is\add* saved by Yahweh,
the shield of your help,
and who \add is\add* the sword of your triumph,
and your enemies, they shall fawn before you,\f + \fr 33:29 \ft Hebrew “to you” \f*
and you shall tread on their backs.”
